Literature Review: The detection of motion direction by neurons is a complex process that involves multiple linear and nonlinear processing steps. In the visual system of Drosophila, this process is mediated by a network of neurons that work together to compute the direction of motion. The genetic methods available in Drosophila have led to a rapid progress in our understanding of how neurons compute the direction of motion in this organism. This review aims to summarize the current knowledge on how flies see motion, with a focus on the neural computation involved in motion detection.
